channel.title: The first time I've ever doubted my revision choice
channel.description:
As some of you probably know, I'm a massive proponent of the 508 revision.
Lately however, I'm starting to think it isn't a viable option for running a successful server.
Why? The fact is, there are really only 3 types of people that play RSPS:
[ol][li]The nostalgic players who want everything to be like it was in the good 'ole days. 317 with no custom items and such.[/li] [li]The half-nostalgic players who want the graphics and such to be like ye-olden times, but with the custom items and such of today's servers. (I like to call these the 'stoidi')[/li] [li]The people that enjoy the new types of things Runescape has, but can't stand the slow leveling or money making.[/li][/ol]
Back when I started RSPS, 508 was an example of #3, but now it goes up to what? Like 660+? 508 doesn't really fit into any of these anymore. There are only the select few that would play a 508, either because they are outdated or because they are TOO new. I've been sticking with 508 because I'm extremely familiar with it and I've been working on my source for 3 years.
So I have two questions for you, of the three above, which are you? And then, do you think I should switch to a newer revision from 508 (I am not going down to a lower one)? And then just a straight answer because I haven't been keeping up: What is the current highest revision with a working server/client pair? Can you give me a few names of sources of that revision? I'd need to take a look at the new protocol.
I believe I could convert my current server (Champions Realm) to a higher revision with not too much effort, as I've slowly been making it much more ambiguous than it was to begin with.

item.title: The first time I've ever doubted my revision choice
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

474 is my favorite. /opinion

Read full topic

item.title: The first time I've ever doubted my revision choice
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I love what BattleScape does for their graphic options. Before client startup, they allow you to choose high/low memory usage AND select your graphics (474, 525, 562, 603). They also have a ton of customizable graphic options in-game too, like hitmarkers and HP bars.

Read full topic
item.source: The first time I've ever doubted my revision choice

item.title: The first time I've ever doubted my revision choice
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:37, topic:426148”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=528840.msg3863391#msg3863391 date=1324791812]
Run a RuneScape classic server.
[/quote]I can’t play a RSC server for more than 30 seconds without getting bored.

However we do plan on taking a lot of the things that make RSC servers great (like the online capabilities) and implementing them. In fact everyone on my team except me is from RSC teams

@Outsider - 508 graphics (LD, which is all we support at the moment) are virtually the same as 317, except the game frame is changed a tiny bit. I do plan on sticking with 508 for now.[/quote]
Indeed, the graphics that “broke the game” are in the 600’s.

Read full topic

item.title: The first time I've ever doubted my revision choice
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

I’m number one, and I recommend you do number one, not because I prefer it but because someone like you would make a good example and maybe take a lead. You already said you’ve been working on a 3 year old server (wow), so you should lead by example.

I logged onto DavidScape once, it had no players online.

Old school needs more capable minds like yourself involved. Find a revision you like and stick to it’s era’s content (if you decide to go below 508). Don’t play with the cache too much.

My opinion before I go to sleep.

508+ graphics and animations are horrible and not what RuneScape should be about. Old school is what most of us desire, you’ll have greater success with old school as time goes by.

Read full topic
item.source: The first time I've ever doubted my revision choice

item.title: The first time I've ever doubted my revision choice
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:31, topic:426148”]How exactly do custom items ruin a game server? Its just the same as Jagex releasing new items and armor. I don’t mean recolors, I mean REAL custom items, new swords, NPCs, ect.[/quote]Oh, if that’s what you want it’s a bit different. I thought you meant putting in newer revision stuff into a remake. Mind you, once you do start adding custom content, it’s no longer a remake. I’m all for custom content, but keep in mind that remake is different than a ‘old fashioned’ private server with some custom content.

Read full topic
item.source: The first time I've ever doubted my revision choice

item.title: The first time I've ever doubted my revision choice
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:31, topic:426148”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=528840.msg3858087#msg3858087 date=1324497338]

[quote author=the elve age link=topic=528840.msg3858060#msg3858060 date=1324496078]
How far is pulling a Palidino and making 4 different revisions in one?

But really, stick to your 508 David. Start thinking outside the box with ideas, try to make your own custom items, add special attacks. Make bounty hunter a different game type than pking.
[/quote]At first I was like And then I read ‘try to make your own custom items, add special attacks’ and I was :mad::mad::mad::mad::mad: I hate custom items. Hence why I call people interested in #2 [custom stuff] ‘stoidi’ (idiots backwards ;D)

[quote author=tinyscape link=topic=528840.msg3858080#msg3858080 date=1324497066]
508’s are the best.
[/quote]I know they are… but I kinda wanna have the new graphics

EDIT - I’ve decided to keep 508 for now and just try to keep the server as ambiguous as possible in case we decide to switch later on. Thanks everyone for the feedback.
[/quote]How exactly do custom items ruin a game server? Its just the same as Jagex releasing new items and armor. I don’t mean recolors, I mean REAL custom items, new swords, NPCs, ect.[/quote]
Who does that though? no one, people re-color items, or edit an item to make it stronger.

Read full topic

[quote=“kickingjamie, post:18, topic:426148”]1 and 3, you should stick with your 508 david.[/quote]I would like to, but I just don’t feel like it would appeal to the masses :\ And if we’re going to spend a lot of money on advertising it would need to

[quote=“Tom_BETA, post:19, topic:426148”]You should make it like the recent Davidscape you put up, but this time keep it online, I was the best in the land at thieving [size=1pt]and writing scripts to cheat[/size]

All your players would PM me asking how did I level so fast? I’m just good [size=1pt]at writing scripts to cheat[/size][/quote]Haha. Well I mostly fixed that

item.title: The first time I've ever doubted my revision choice
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:13, topic:426148”]I just looked at the most popular servers on a toplist and it seems that they all have a few things in common. Those things are: they advertise extremely well (which our team has covered), and they have high revision content (even if its a low revision base)

What this says to me is, people enjoy the high revision content, there just haven’t been enough well developed high revision servers to give people the fun gameplay that is delivered with a well content-oriented base. I think that if we can put all those things into one, it would work out.

Anyone have any counter arguments?

EDIT - Oh and they all have well thought out PvP rewards and such, which I’m sure we could work in.[/quote]
Most are shitty ass servers that just want profit, innovationx, before the shitty update they did that made everything like loading 602, it was old revision, had tons of custom content, tons online daily and highly voted, thats the kind of server I meant.

Read full topic
